Reviews.Title: Few flaws
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a great for its value. You get a quad-core 2.5Ghz and 3.5Ghz with turbo core. The Graphic's card is decent with 2GB of video ram. It will run Far Cry and Starcraft with fairly ease. Touchscreen is decent and display is fairly crisp. Acer has a history of trying out new designs such as the much like the acer r7, however what the this product does different is having the power button on the side and most all the ports on the back except 2 usb 2.0 on the side-Bang for your Buck-responsive touchscreen display-crisp clear display-unlisted backlit keyboard-good speakerscons-hard to open with no gap (must need some nails) becomes more annoying then you think-runs loud when with turbo core-plastic casing-smudge magnet-awkward keyboard-standard 4 hour battery life.RevisedThis computer after 10 months is constantly dropping connection.

Reviews.Title: I would HIGHLY reccommend
Reviews.Author: M. Quinn
Reviews.Content: This arrived on time and wow Acer has a home run product. The touch screen works perfectly the set up was so easy and my son who will be taking this off to College in 2 weeks loves it. Price, size and features make this a steal even at twice the cost. Thinking about buying one for my self graphics are that good Netflix runs and looks better then on my Plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal on a Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: cattrelc
Reviews.Content: This this is amazing.  I was a little nervous about both windows 8 and the touchscreen aspect but they are both quite nice.  The touchscreen has worked very well so far altho i usually have this hooked up to my TV via HDMI.  It plays D3, SC2 and GW2 at near top levels, even in 1080p on the 46" tv.  The only two downsides that I can see is the lack of an optical drive, which I bough with the computer, and only 3 USB ports.  Only one of them is a USB 3 and it is located on the back of the laptop which is kind of annoying.  I can't complain too much tho as the machine runs super smooth and fast.  It also looks and feels very solid and is quite slim.  All in all, I think this might be the best laptop I have owned!

Reviews.Title: Everything is a little bit better, screen should be higher res
Reviews.Author: Steven A. Hanifl "stahs"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model after having problems running poorly optimized games on an A8-3500M Toshiba brand laptop. I'm not entirely sure if the problem was a low 1.5 ghz clock speed, or simply that the onboard graphics were too underpowered to run most games (Radeon 6620g). This was a surprise to me since the a8 was touted as being a game capable unit, when I bought it, by the computing community, however later I found out that it all depended on the game: Some games are simply not as capable of using the hardware as others. After a few days of off and on work however, most games managed to function well enough to play, though this was borderline.The Acer Aspire 552pg-x809 is clearly in a different league than most a8 and a10 laptops due to having 2 graphic chips in tandem: the onboard 8650m capable Radeon cores on the APU, and a dedicated 8750m Radeon discrete chip. Now I finally have a rig that is capable of running pretty much any MMO that I try, as of Feb. 2014. While I wouldn't necessarily be turned off of APU only laptops, I doubt that an everyday user would be able to get games to run sufficiently well on them, frankly. Even on this Acer, ignoring all the optimization you can learn to do, you are not informed about basics like the Switchable Graphics option (by right clicking on the desktop, and selecting the item), which is where you enable specific apps to use both cards in tandem. It is set to default to the single core onboard the APU, meaning that missing this little detail is a key difference between game and no game! Now I am an old hand at desktops, but if I would not have run across other reviews talking about it, I would not have known what to look for. Incidentally, with limited certainty I can advise you not to use the AMD.com drivers, since Switchable Graphics isn't accessible after installing them, and I actually had to roll back my system to get this option to work again. You will have to go with the Acer supplied drivers, supposedly.Core gaming function out of the way, I can tell you this laptop is sexy, and capable in other aspects as well. The touchscreen works flawlessly, the WiFi is a/b/g/n (meaning 5ghz 802.11n), the keyboard is highly functional, and the trackpad is decent. All of these items are one notch above any other laptop in the same price range, which means Acer gets my vote for Vendor That Gets It: This is a gaming laptop well south of $1000 that doesn't skimp on anything. I believe this laptop was a new design vehicle, since the margins can't really be all that great. The only skimp is one typical of all 15.6 inch A8 and A10 laptops: a 1366 by 768 screen resolution that doesn't do the unit justice frankly, though contrary to reviews I find the screen to be crisp and bright. There is a bonus in that games only have to pump 720p of pixels, which improves framerate while still maintaining crisp graphics. Little known fact is that LED monitors don't scale well to lower resolutions, so in my experience it is better to run at the monitor's native resolution.As for Windows 8, it only takes a few days to get used to, but I can understand how those few days trudging around the new UI would lead to some choice words, my advice is to learn to use the Windows key, and perhaps even take a course or buy a book on the OS. While that seems a little radical, some people are just not going to be able to figure this UI out any other way, and because I have yet to do this, I simply don't know how to dig for every setting, as I could on W7 yet.The one bizarre aspect of this monitor that makes me think it is a design vehivle, is that the majority of ports are situated on the rear of the unit, including the USB 3.0 port, and especially the power port. This effectively means you have to keep the rear of the unit in mind when shifting positions. Personally I have not run into a problem yet, but I can imagine use case scenarios where cables coming from the back could make for interesting situations. The reason the plugs are on the back, by the way, is that this is an UltraThin laptop... the sides are simply too short in most areas to accommodate ports. This device is sexy, no doubt... It is wonderful to look at, but you begin to understand why laptops are the way they are after seeing this beaut.TL;DR Sexy, capable, and a steal at 800$.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop
Reviews.Author: DeAndra
Reviews.Content: Wow. I am very impressed with this laptop. The quad core processor is super fast and the dual graphics are excellent. This computer has good gaming capabilities but don't expect to play on ultra settings with every game. I use this laptop to game and edit videos. It does very well on each of those. I recommend this computer to anyone who will be doing demanding CPU tasks on the go. This computer can handle them very well. It is super slim and very easy to travel with. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Christina Witherell
Reviews.Content: So far, I love it. The layout is great. Function keys are not automatic ( I use them for gaming. It's nice not to accidentally exit .)Runs everything I need it to with ease.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop I've used
Reviews.Author: Marissa Skindel
Reviews.Content: I needed a new laptop for schoolwork since I needed to be able to run specific programs for my my major.  It's done an excellent job so far and I've had it since August.  It's pretty quick and the start up time is only a few seconds.  It had all my minimal requirements of a backlit keyboard and touchscreen while exceeding in the hard drive and storage.  This is definitely the best computer for the price and if I had to go back to when I bought it, I would definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: EVERYTHING I NEED!
Reviews.Author: Joe Vasiloff
Reviews.Content: First off one thing I love about this computer: The Sound. HOLY MOLY! I can't believe how good the speakers are! Dolby does not disappoint. Another thing I was really stoked about: the new Windows 8 operating system. At first it was a bit tricky I will admit, but after using it a few times I really like it! The computer also runs really fast and the screen is a very nice size. Watching movies on this computer is basically like watching a small sized HD TV with awesome Dolby Speakers (4 Speakers TOO! WHAT?! I LOVE IT!). So even though I am not a gamer I can see how this would definitely appeal to those looking for a laptop of that nature. This computer is also very thin and light for how much awesomeness it carries. THANK YOU ACER!

Reviews.Title: Impressive!
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer for my neice who is going to college this fall and she loves it!!  The touch screen is awsome and the backlighted keyboard is very cool!  The Champagne Ice color is just beautiful; i've never seen anything like it.  Very reasonably priced also.  Would highly recommend; in fact I am probably going to get one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Best computer my mom has ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Ribbs
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 62 year old mother. She loves it! She had a cheap acer previously, but it was one of those $299.99 laptops that quickly become obsolete. I liked this one because of the color, the specs, and touchscreen. She loves it and has quickly adapted to Windows 8 from Vista thanks to the touchscreen. She is thrown when using computers without one now.The hardware in this thing is top notch! My mom likes to play games (primarily adventure games and find the item games, but she does play The Walking Dead), so the video card is more than adequate. The processor is speedy too. There is no CD/DVD/Burner/Blu-Ray in this laptop. I knew this up front and didn't care. The only slouch in this unit is the large, but slow internal hard drive. For my mom though, a good price for a good piece of hardware!The design is very nice. The champagne tint to the aluminum is a nice touch. The unit looks well constructed, is extremely thin, and is very light. The ultra light weight of this unit is nice for my mother as well. It honestly feels like it weighs as much as a tablet. I'm sure that's an exaggeration, but it is light!You won't go wrong with this unit. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: Only cons , it DIDNT say it came DVD/Bluray  , and that it gets VERY hot in the back , plus its WINDOWS 8 .....that's defenitly a con .

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Lover of Truth
Reviews.Content: I've got no complaints with this one. I have researched for months, and had to return a few other laptops.This one does and has everything that it says.I especially like how the touch screen NEVER glitches or stops working. I think Acer finally made a solid product, that works as it should ALL THE TIME.My favorite is the sound on this machine! It's amazing.It does get rather hot at times though. Besides that, I'm a very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: No Regrets Here
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop for college and happens to be my first laptop. I also run a couple games on it and it runs them better than I expected. (Games such as Minecraft and Gmod, so nothing very elaborate.) So far it's proven to be very useful for school and is pretty lightweight. The only real complaints that I have are that the mouse pad isn't as responsive as I think it should be and it's difficult putting flash drives and such into the USB ports. I've only ever had an old Dell desktop, so I don't know much, but this laptop is very useful to me. Overall a good buy in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop.
Reviews.Author: VE251186 SAMUEL
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great. TouchScreen, Great Power, Slim, I love it. With AMD this is perfect. only i dont like the trackball.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Maren K Thompson
Reviews.Content: It works as I expected based upon reports I had received.  I just have to get used to using the touch screen and windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop!!!
Reviews.Author: sevaram
Reviews.Content: This is a really best laptop ever!!!Touch screen is very responsible,it's also got awesome speakers which is dolby home theater v4!!!Backlit keyboard is a pretty cool feature))Laptop is a very thin n lightweight with a perfect finished design!!! u won't go wrong with it!!!!HIGLY RECOMMEND IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Jose Ariel Laureano
Reviews.Content: Got what I was expecting to get! Touch screen is excellent just like a smart phone!Good PriceLightweightI really recommended!

Reviews.Title: Ok if that's what you're looking for
Reviews.Author: Wootieli
Reviews.Content: When I got this, I was shocked at the size and weight. I had not noticed in the pic that it has a full number keypad to the right of the keyboard which makes it so wide. I almost packaged it right back up and sent it back then. But decided to give it a fair trial. Hated Win 8 as many do. Never bonded with this laptop so I did end up returning it and found my soulmate in a Fujitsu.  This laptop is nice to look at and worked fine but it was slower than I expected for the specs. Loved the color but was just not what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for this price point
Reviews.Author: Wilmo07
Reviews.Content: This Acer is a good deal for the money, but is not as fast as I would like. Not a huge deal as a student, but important for some people. Furthermore, contrary to previous reviews, I have been unable to update to Microsoft 8.1 on this computer, so various apps are unavailable. This is likely a Microsoft issue and I'll have to deal with them about it. It's a great color and I've gotten lots of compliments. There is substantial space between the keys (more than a Mac, I believe), so don't be surprised about that. The keyboard is also very quiet, as is the machine itself. I have had no substantial issues with it thus far and I have been using it for about a month.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Value
Reviews.Author: Troy Scott Thomason
Reviews.Content: This laptop is awesome. It runs Skyrim and many other games perfectly. The sound is awesome for a laptop. Word of warning: if you use the touch screen, the smudges are nearly impossible to get off.Also, windows 8 took me maybe 5 minutes to figure out, and I love it!I got this laptop 15% off with free shipping, saving $120. Best value I could find.

ProductInfo.Features:
AMD A10-5757M 2.5GHz (4MB cache)
8 GB DDR3 RAM
1 TB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, AMD Radeon? HD 8750M Graphics
Windows 8, 4.5-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: Acer Aspire V5-552PG-X809 15.6-inch Touchscreen Laptop (Champagne Ice)
